text:
hey! so I took a look through them, I would say Hertfordshire and Van arts were the best there. If im honest im judging predominantly on the quality of the work they show and how likely I think that work could get someone a job. I would say that it appears Vanarts is the best. But im not sure the difference is that great.
Im pretty wary of encouraging you to go for van arts as im sure its significantly mroe expensive, plus one of the most expensive cities in the world etc and a I say im not sure the difference is that great.  Also universities in UK you have the opportunity to properly visit
at the end of the day which ever you go to - you will need to self learn most of the useful skill that you will get
it sounds bad i know but its the students that push them selves harder that get jobs not the ones who went to the best schools
if it helps ive seen graduate anim reels from hertfordshire that were good
Did you look at Bournemouth? its traditionally one of the bigger names for it in the UK
I would strongly recommend going to open days of any that you are interested in
because lets be honest its a lot of how you are goign to make an opinion and you need to know if you liek the town !
